de.xypron.jcobyla

Class CobylaTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.xypron.jcobyla.CobylaTest

  • public class CobylaTest
extends Object
    Test class for COBYLA2 employing tests from Report DAMTP 1992/NA5.
    Author:
    Anders Gustafsson, Cureos AB.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CobylaTest() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void test01FindMinimum()
      Minimization of a simple quadratic function of two variables.
      void test02FindMinimum()
      Easy two dimensional minimization in unit circle.
      void test03FindMinimum()
      Easy three dimensional minimization in ellipsoid.
      void test04FindMinimum()
      Weak version of Rosenbrock's problem.
      void test05FindMinimum()
      Intermediate version of Rosenbrock's problem.
      void test06FindMinimum()
      This problem is taken from Fletcher's book Practical Methods of Optimization and has the equation number (9.1.15).
      void test07FindMinimum()
      This problem is taken from Fletcher's book Practical Methods of Optimization and has the equation number (14.4.2).
      void test08FindMinimum()
      This problem is taken from page 66 of Hock and Schittkowski's book Test Examples for Nonlinear Programming Codes.
      void test09FindMinimum()
      This problem is taken from page 111 of Hock and Schittkowski's book Test Examples for Nonlinear Programming Codes.
      void test10FindMinimum()
      This problem is taken from page 415 of Luenberger's book Applied Nonlinear Programming.

        public void test07FindMinimum()

      • test08FindMinimum

        public void test08FindMinimum()
        This problem is taken from page 66 of Hock and Schittkowski's book Test Examples for Nonlinear Programming Codes. It is their test problem Number 43, and has the name Rosen-Suzuki.

      • test09FindMinimum

        public void test09FindMinimum()
        This problem is taken from page 111 of Hock and Schittkowski's book Test Examples for Nonlinear Programming Codes. It is their test problem Number 100.

      • test10FindMinimum

        public void test10FindMinimum()
        This problem is taken from page 415 of Luenberger's book Applied Nonlinear Programming. It is to maximize the area of a hexagon of unit diameter.
